intro: Centropogon cornutus, commonly known as the horned centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soil. Its unique horn-like structures on the flower buds are a distinguishing feature. Centropogon cornutus plays an important ecological role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
